Starry, Starry Night
Night — a realm where a different set of rules, social systems, and star-lit environments come alive. Under streetlights and shadows, the night unveils hidden layers of time, speed, and perception, fostering excitement and giving the unknown space to roam. It reveals what the daylight conceals, offering a unique perspective on the dreamers and the worlds they inhabit. We invite artists to submit work that explores the mysteries of the night, the vastness of the sky, and the vibrant life that thrives in darkness. Whether your art captures the natural world, the cosmos, or the emotions evoked by nighttime, we welcome your creative interpretations for this exhibition.
Submission deadline: Sept 22
Exhibit Dates: NOVEMBER 7, 2025 –DECEMBER 29, 2025
Apply

Jazz & Java: Latin Jazz – Rhythms and Musicians
October 16 @ 10:00 am
-
11:30 am
$155 (Including Fees)
Event header
Navigation
«
All Arts Open Mic
Nicole Henry Returns – Friday
»
#tribe-events-header
Event featured image, but exclude link
Event content
Join Professor Richard Lowenthal as he presents Latin music starting with Spanish song forms, African rhythms and harmonies, and influences from Cuba, Brazil and many Caribbean rhythms. He will demonstrate how they combined with American ballad and blues, jazz and rock, and other contemporary forms. There will be several listening examples from the past 100 years, with the emphasis on Jazz and Latin groups, that include: Louis Armstrong and Jelly Roll Morton, Xavier Cugat, Tito Puente, Machito and Charlie Parker and Dizzy Gillespie, The Buena Vista Social Club, Paquito D’Rivera, Arturo Sandoval, Chucho Valdés, and Stan Getz, among others. The class will listen to different types of rhythms, such as cha-cha-cha, mambo, rhumba, bossa nova, samba and the percussion instruments involved in the music. All are welcome to see and hear how Jazz and Latin music are connected.
Instructor Bio:
Richard Lowenthal, Professor Emeritus, is a noted Jazz Educator, Conductor, and performer for the past 55 years. Professor Lowenthal founded the Jazz Department at the prestigious Manhattan School of Music and was Chair of the Department as well as conductor of the award-winning Jazz Orchestra for 19 years.
In addition, he also started the Jazz Program at New Jersey City University, one of the first Universities to offer a Jazz Degree in the state. Dick instituted the Jazz and Java Series as part of the Adult Education Program at the Arts Garage and it was the first of its kind in the state of Florida. His performance credits include conductor of the Special Unit of the Glenn Miller Orchestra and contractor and trumpeter for Clark Terry, Mel Torme, Tony Bennett and Nancy Wilson. He also played trumpet with Machito’s Afro- Cuban Band during the 1960’s. He is currently chair of the Board of directors of the Arts Garage.

Connecting our community to the world through the Arts. Our vision drives all of our decisions at Arts Garage. Our programs bring established global performers and renowned regional talent into our South Florida multicultural community — students and adults, locals and tourists, people of all ages, income levels, and backgrounds – all who share a love of the arts. Community is a hallmark of our work at Arts Garage. We provide a wide variety of music genres and art disciplines to reach everyone in our community. #AccessForAll isn’t just our tagline: it is the cornerstone of our programs, outreach & community collaborations, staffing, and marketing.
OUR MISSION Arts Garage delivers innovative, diverse, meaningful and accessible visual and performing arts experiences to Delray Beach and the South Florida community. Music Arts Garage hosts nearly 1,000 performers on our stage each year. From Grammy Award-winning musicians – big bands to singer-songwriters, our captivating shows span an eclectic range of musical styles including Jazz, Blues, Soul, Latin music and more. These diverse rhythms bring dynamic and culturally enriching experiences to our community, making Arts Garage a hub for musical exploration and appreciation. Visual Arts The Marshall Family Foundation Gallery at Arts Garage champions regional and emerging visual artists by showcasing works that engage our eclectic audience. All artists have a reception, aligned with Delray Beach’s monthly Art Walk, drawing people to their exhibit. Helping local artists gain exposure and earn money through the sale of their work to collectors, our gallery curates six themed exhibits, showcasing over 30 artists each year. Arts Education With both adult and children’s arts education programming, Arts Garage provides a variety of opportunities for locals to grow their talents and knowledge of the Visual & Performing Arts. Acting classes and Jazz lectures engage adults in the pursuit of their passions, and summer camp and after-school opportunities provide enrichment in the arts for children & youth. Our Artists-in-Residence (AiR) series at Arts Garage engages the community through master classes, lectures, and other experiences for youth, underserved members, and lifelong learners. Comedy The Art of Laughter, our monthly stand-up comedy series, presents a masterful blend of wit, talent, and charm by top-tier professional and nationally touring comedians. Our featured comedians offer a wide range of comedic styles with notable appearances on Comedy Central, America’s Got Talent, CONAN, The Late Late Show with James Corden, Kevin Hart’s LOL Network, Netflix and more. Theatre Arts Garage intentionally stages plays that inspire meaningful conversations through innovative and thought-provoking productions. From dramas to comedies, our season consists of three professional shows written by cutting-edge, dynamic playwrights from around the country. Curated to address universally relevant themes, theatre at Arts Garage actively engages our community by inspiring young thespians and awakening our creative selves. Volunteers Volunteers make our mission possible! Since 2011, our volunteers have dedicated over 85,000 hours providing valuable assistance with patron support, events setup, and ushering performances. By offering our volunteers the opportunity to attend shows as patrons, they too can enjoy world-class events presented at Arts Garage. To show our appreciation, we host volunteer celebrations three times a year with fun, interactive art-based activities. Access to All Arts Garage connects our community to the world through the arts. This vision is founded on our commitment to provide access to Arts & Culture for everyone. Our pARTner Program and our many community collaborations allow us to engage our entire community, providing over 1,000 free tickets annually ensuring that everyone has an opportunity to attend our events. Sponsor an Event Sponsoring an event at Arts Garage allows us to deliver innovative, diverse, meaningful and accessible visual and performing arts experiences to Delray Beach and the South Florida community. Pick your favorite discipline of the arts and share your passion! Sponsorship opportunities are available for music performances, standup comedy, theatre and more! When you sponsor an event, your name will be featured in our program, on our website, and on stage on the night of the event. Contact Us Directly Sponsorship Opportunities Ranky Tanky November 16, 2024 @ 8:00 pm - 10:00 pm

“Every expression of art represents a diversity of cultures and experiences. When we provide our community the opportunity and access to arts programming, we create a vehicle for transformation — for individuals, for communities, and for the globe.” –Marjorie Waldo, President and CEO, Arts Garage

Meet Our Staff Marjorie Waldo President & CEO See Bio Suzanne Haley House Manager Katlyn Menjivar Chief Administrator Darius Ward Contract & Facility Manager Naja Hardmon Art Curator Seth Weaver Marketing Director Keyshliany Pérez Marketing Coordinator Latifah AlSaad Graphic Designer Adriana Gioeni Graphic Designer Michelle Diaz Artistic Director of Theatre Mary Ann Canuso Group Sales Manager & Box Office Andrea Gomez Volunteer Coordinator & Box Office Narcisse Wilson Box Office Joseph Montagnino Assistant House Karen King Bartender Faith Joyce Marketing Assistant Francesca Peuguero Admin & Programming Assistant Izmira Santiago Director of Development & Community Engagement Lori Estrella-Auger Assistant House

Richard Lowenthal, Chair Dick Lowenthal has been a Jazz Educator for over 50 years. He was Chair and founder of the prestigious Jazz Department at the Manhattan School of Music and developed the Jazz Department at New Jersey City University, where he is a Professor Emeritus. He received a Bachelor of Music from the The University of Michigan and a Masters in Trumpet from the Juilliard School of Music. He was Vice-President of the International Association of Jazz Educators and chair of the National Music Council. As a performer Dick has played with Clark Terry, Bill Watrous, Mel Torme, Tony Bennett, Nancy Wilson, and Cher. He has conducted the Special Unit of the Glenn Miller Orchestra on tours of Japan, Poland, cruise ships, Presidential functions and the Tony Awards. Dick started the very successful Adult Education Program at Arts Garage that is called Jazz and Java. He became Chair of Arts Garage in October of 2023.
Steven G. Rappaport, Vice Chair Steven G. Rappaport is an Equity Partner in the Community Associations Practice Group at Sachs Sax Caplan Law Firm. With extensive experience spanning over two decades, Mr. Rappaport handles transactional matters for the firm’s community association clients, including drafting amendments to governing documents, attending Board meetings and elections, handling covenant enforcement disputes, and providing opinions on all aspects of association issues. Admitted to the Bar in Florida in 2003 and in the District of Columbia in 2001, Steven obtained his J.D. from Georgetown University Law Center, where he actively contributed to esteemed legal publications. He graduated magna cum laude with a B.A. in Political Science from the University of Florida in 1998. In addition to his legal practice, Steven has served as a Board Member and Committee Chair for several organizations including the Palm Beach County Fair Housing and Equal Employment Board, South Palm Beach County Bar Association, and Community Associations Institute (CAI) Florida Legislative Alliance.
Mark Burns, Secretary Mark Burns is the Chief Operating Officer at BlueIvy Communications, a Delray Beach-based boutique communications and public relations agency with offices in West Palm Beach and Delray Beach. Originally from Baltimore, Maryland, Mark moved to Delray Beach in 2014 and was the owner-operator of an Orangetheory Fitness Studio before joining BlueIvy in 2016. Mark is a member of the Impact 100 Men of Palm Beach County and Former Chair and current Advisory Committee member of WiseTribe. Mark is a co-founder of Delray Beach-basedrunning group, Pineapple Run Crew, and in 2022 served as the Volunteer Team Manager at the World Maccabi Games in Israel. He is also a member of the Greater Delray Beach Chamber of Commerce and the Palm Beach Chamber of Commerce. Combining his love of live music and the arts with a passion for improving the local community, Mark became a board member of the Arts Garage in 2023.
Jack Varsalona, Treasurer Jack recently retired as President of Wilmington University in Delaware. He holds a BA, MA and Ph.D. from the University of Delaware. From 1975-78, he was Principal of Ursuline Academy, a prominent Catholic school in Wilmington. He was then Director of Development at the University of Delaware from 1978-81 and served as an education aide in the cabinet of former Delaware governor, Pete DuPont. Before becoming 3rd president of then Wilmington College, Jack was a professor and then Executive Vice President for Academic and Student Affairs. He was quickly promoted to EVP and Provost and in 2005 was elected President by the Board of Trustees. During his tenure, Wilmington College became a University, enrollment doubled, three new campuses were opened, and partnerships with community colleges in NJ, MD and Delaware were developed to provide a “feeder” system. He has served on the boards of a variety of organizations and has won numerous awards for his community leadership.
Chuck Halberg, Director Chuck Halberg began his career in construction in Michigan in 1975 and has been a resident of Florida since 1980 and a Florida Licensed General Contractor since 1986. A South Florida Construction Management Executive, Chuck has worked for three different top 200 National Builders and has overseen the construction of over 2500 residential units, 3500 apartments, a ten-story high rise, 800,000 square feet of commercial space and a 220-bed nursing home. Chuck has many personal strengths in business relations including product development, budget management, quality control, and customer satisfaction. Chuck has been active in the Delray Beach community since 1991, serving as a volunteer and supporting many Non-Profits including Delray Citizens for Delray Police, the Achievement Center for Children & Families, The Miracle League, The Spady Museum, The Delray Beach Chamber of Commerce and many others. In addition, he has been on various City of Delray Boards including the Affordable Housing Board and the Planning and Zoning Board among others.
Susan Owens, Director Susan, a Delray Beach resident who maintains a home in her native state of New Jersey, is currently President and Managing Member of several real estate partnerships. Susan has had a passion for the Arts since early childhood. Her summers were spent in varying Arts programs from Interlochen, Michigan to The Aspen Music Festival in Colorado. She worked as a freelance musician in New York City after graduating with a Bachelor’s of Music degree from the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor. A firm believer in both the positive and powerful impact of the Arts on society, Susan feels very lucky to have been both an employee and supporter at City Center Theater in NYC. Following her passion for helping people raise awareness and civil rights, Susan has served as a National Board member of Lambda Legal, as well as Chaired numerous annual Fundraisers having helped raise hundreds of thousands of dollars.
Robin Greene, Director Robin Greene has devoted her life to Special Education with children from 0 to 3 year old in classrooms and privately in New York and South Florida. Robin loves music and even includes music in many of her sessions with children.  She finds that music is one of the best ways to reach people of all ages and make them happy.  Children learn words through music and improve their social skills. Robin grew up in a musical  family – her mother was a singer and both her parents believed strongly in the arts and culture. Robin and her husband Stephen love giving back to their community.  Their family supports the Miracle League and other organizations including Arts Garage.  Robin loves what Arts Garage brings to others – smiling faces, dancing and the enjoyment the shows bring.  Robin is passionate about music and about Arts Garage.
Elise Rubenstein, Director As a Board member of the Jewish Community Center in Baltimore for 15 years, I have planned events, been involved with fundraising, sat on Nominating Committees and other strategic planning for the Center. Presently, I am the Chair of Governance, with a committee of 12 people that work on issues around Board Engagement, Vision and Mission statements, Nominating and DEI. Our JCC has a 500-person performance theater, and I have been involved with decision making around programming, capital improvements and staffing. I have also been involved with the Walter’s Art Museum in Baltimore. I was a member of the Women’s Committee, which was responsible for creating and running fundraising event for the Museum. My husband and I are also supporters of the Freeman Stage, which is a 4,000-person venue near our home in Delaware. We love the arts and feel its important to support the venues where we live! So thrilled to be a part of the Arts Garage Family and support their amazing efforts to advance all the arts in Delray!
John Engle, Director John embarked on a dynamic journey within IT and software development over 40 years ago. With a distinguished 24-year tenure at a single company, he joined a young startup of about 190 people and contributed to its growth into a global leader with over 13,000 employees after a major merger. Beginning in Quality Assurance, John honed his skills in product excellence and reliability, then advanced through roles as a product analyst, product manager, and people manager. His keen understanding of market needs, user experience, and unique “outside the box” approach drove successful product launches and enhancements that propelled the company’s growth. In addition to his corporate achievements, John has dedicated himself to community leadership. He served for three years as the President of the Cannery Row HOA board, fostering community engagement and effective governance. Now in a semi-retired capacity, John channels his passion for innovation into real estate investing and development, leveraging his extensive leadership experience to create and enhance communities beyond the digital realm.
Patricia Glass Schuman, Director Patricia Glass Schuman, librarian, publisher, artist, and free speech activist, co-founded Neal-Schuman Publishers with John Vincent Neal. Pat is a graduate of the University of Cincinnati and Columbia University. She was the first woman elected Treasurer of the American Library Association and was later elected its President. A founder of ALA’s Advocacy Network and the Neal-Schuman Foundation, Pat also served as Chair of the New York Metropolitan Reference and Research Library Agency (METRO) and held board positions with Friends of Libraries U.S.A., the Trejo Foster Foundation, and the New York University Publishing Center. Her advocacy work has led to appearances on more than 70 radio and television programs, including a feature on Washington Week in Review. The author or editor of five books and over 100 journal articles, she has lectured nationally and internationally, testified before the U.S. Congress, and served as a visiting professor at numerous universities. Her many honors include the ALA Equality Award, the Joseph W. Lippincott Award, and Distinguished Alumni Awards from both the University of Cincinnati and Columbia University. She recently received the American Library Association’s highest honor, Honorary Membership. Pat was also recently featured as an emerging artist at Arts Garage.
Ronnie Dunayer, Ex-Officio Ronnie is a Professional Golf Instructor. Over the past 20 years, she has devoted herself to the sport of golf as an instructor, sports psychologist, and event planner, and she has taught in South Florida for nearly a decade. Her experience includes coordinating specialized programs for adults and junior golfers as well as for people with various disabilities. A graduate of Adelphi University, she earned a Master’s Degree in Psychology and specialized in working with athletes. The blending of technical and mechanical knowledge combined with an understanding of the mental components of the sport contributes to her success rate with varied students.
Lynn Ferguson, Ex-Officio A Northwestern University graduate, Lynn received a master’s degree from the University of Detroit, After more than 30 years of teaching high school mathematics in Michigan, she retired and moved to Orlando Florida, where she finally had time to pursue her lifelong love of oil painting. There, she joined the Central Florida Women’s League in 2002 and served on the Service Committee, Scholarship Committee, Fundraising Committee, and Arts and Culture Committee, which she co-chaired, She also co-chaired the golf tournament fundraiser for two years and served as the league president in 2007; she was on the Foundation board for the next three years. In addition, Lynn co-founded and was president of the “Friends of Orlando Ballet.” There she grew the “Friends” to a membership of 150 and was responsible for raising approximately $60,000 a year. Lynn started the Arts Garage Guild in October 2011 and, as president, has built the membership to more than 230 members. She has also served on the Board of Directors of the Arts Garage since its inception in October 2011.
Paula Tishok, Director Paula Tishok brings a wealth of leadership and nonprofit governance experience across the arts, healthcare, and education sectors. With a professional background that spans Westin Hotels, Westinghouse Electric Corporation, and Tenet Healthcare, Tishok has consistently held senior roles in financial operations and strategic planning. A lifelong supporter of the arts and education, she has served on the boards of The Studios of Key West, Wilson College, and the Alumnae Association of Wilson College, among others. Since relocating to Delray Beach from Key West last year, she has quickly immersed herself in the city’s dynamic and flourishing arts landscape.
David Plaza, Director David Plaza is a Managing Director and Wealth Management Advisor with Merrill Lynch Wealth Management. With nearly four decades of experience in the financial services industry, Plaza holds both the Certified Private Wealth Advisor® and CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER® designations. He has earned numerous accolades, including multiple placements on Forbes’ “Best-in-State Wealth Advisors” and Barron’s “Top 1,200 Financial Advisors” lists. Plaza is a passionate advocate for the arts, having served on the boards of numerous cultural and educational institutions. His civic contributions include leadership roles with the Philadelphia Film Society, the Delaware Symphony Orchestra, the Wilmington Music School, and the Art Consortium of Delaware. He has also supported education through his board work with Ursuline Academy and has been recognized with the Paul Harris Fellow Award for his service with the Wilmington Rotary. A seasoned community builder, Plaza was also the founder and former president of the Wilmington Business Group.
